content:
• Monday, August 13, 2012
  • SUMR

    More on Summer Infant (NASDAQ:SUMR): Q2 misses across the board on flat sales and higher...

    More on Summer Infant (NASDAQ:SUMR): Q2 misses across the board on flat sales and higher expenses. The company also announces plans to layoff up to 10% of its workforce, and withdraws earlier estimates on its FY12 outlook and suspends further guidance, saying that unpredictable market conditions make it difficult to forecast future performance with reliable accuracy. Shares -28% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • ENVI

    Envivio (NASDAQ:ENVI) -39.5% AH after warning it expects FQ2 revenue of $10M-$11M, well below a...

    Envivio (NASDAQ:ENVI) -39.5% AH after warning it expects FQ2 revenue of $10M-$11M, well below a consensus of $17.7M. The provider of "TV Everywhere" hardware/software solutions blames (what else?) soft service provider capex in North America and Western Europe. The news could have negative implications for Synacor (NASDAQ:SYNC), whose fortunes are also heavily tied to TV Everywhere deployments. Envivio is now down 62% from April's $9 IPO price.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM | 4 Comments
  • ARRY

    More on Array BioPharma (NASDAQ:ARRY): FQ4 beats on a 9% Y/Y jump in total revenue. Net losses...

    More on Array BioPharma (NASDAQ:ARRY): FQ4 beats on a 9% Y/Y jump in total revenue. Net losses were pared significantly from the prior year period, as its top line was boosted by a jump in sales and its bottom line benefited from milestone payments from AMGN. Shares +6.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • WX

    WuXi PharmaTech (NYSE:WX): Q2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $130.4M (29+% Y/Y) beats...

    WuXi PharmaTech (NYSE:WX): Q2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $130.4M (29+% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM

  • China plans to release corn and rice from state reserves to cool inflation and ease import...

    China plans to release corn and rice from state reserves to cool inflation and ease import needs. The amount isn't yet known, but is estimated to be around 2M tons (the country consumes 10-15M tons monthly). The grains were sharply lower today as traders mostly sell Friday's news of a short crop. Corn -2.2%, Beans -3.1%, Wheat -3.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARRY

    Array BioPharma (NASDAQ:ARRY): FQ4 EPS of -$0.09 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $20.7M (+9% Y/Y)...

    Array BioPharma (NASDAQ:ARRY): FQ4 EPS of -$0.09 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $20.7M (+9% Y/Y) misses by $0.8M. Shares -2.2% (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • GRPN

    More on Groupon's Q2: Gross billings totaled $1.29B, +39% Y/Y but -4% Q/Q. North American...

    More on Groupon's Q2: Gross billings totaled $1.29B, +39% Y/Y but -4% Q/Q. North American revenue +66% Y/Y and 40% of total, international +31% and 60% of total. Marketing expenses -58% Y/Y, largely responsible for the EPS beat. But cost of revenue +146%, well above revenue growth. Active customers up by 1.1M Q/Q to 38M. Free cash flow of $48.6M, down from Q1's $70.6M. GRPN now -14.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • SUMR

    Summer Infant (NASDAQ:SUMR): Q2 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $61.7M (+1.1% Y/Y)...

    Summer Infant (NASDAQ:SUMR): Q2 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $61.7M (+1.1% Y/Y) misses by $2M. Shares -19.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN): Q2 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $568.3M (+45% Y/Y) misses by...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN): Q2 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $568.3M (+45% Y/Y) misses by $4.8M. Expects Q3 revenue of $580M-$620M, in-line with $604.5M consensus. Expects Q3 operating income of $15M-$35M, below Q2's $46.5M. Shares -7.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 6 Comments
  • AUQ

    AuRico Gold (AUQ -7%) is among the day's biggest losers after reporting Q2 adjusted earnings...

    AuRico Gold (AUQ -7%) is among the day's biggest losers after reporting Q2 adjusted earnings fell to $0.08/share from $0.22 because of a drop in total gold production, though sales grew slightly.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • MCPIQ

    Standard & Poor's downgrades Molycorp (MCP -4.9%) two notches further into junk territory,...

    Standard & Poor's downgrades Molycorp (MCP -4.9%) two notches further into junk territory, to CCC+ from B, and places its ratings on watch with "developing implications," noting the rare-earth miner's cash flow likely will be less than it expected this year due to lower prices and customer destocking.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • CATM

    Although Cardtronics (CATM -3.9%) reported in-line Q2 results last week, J.P. Morgan downgrades...

    Although Cardtronics (CATM -3.9%) reported in-line Q2 results last week, J.P. Morgan downgrades shares to Neutral, saying the ATM owner and operator reiterated fiscal year guidance but "downplayed the potential for near-term EPS upside." The firm believes earnings growth is normalizing to CATM's longer-term target and future beats/raises are less likely.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • GRPN

    Up nearly 8% earlier, Groupon (GRPN -1.2%) turns lower on sharply higher volume, suggesting,...

    Up nearly 8% earlier, Groupon (GRPN -1.2%) turns lower on sharply higher volume, suggesting, says John Melloy, a big buyer wants out ahead of this afternoon's earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 3 Comments
  • AA

    The Dow is improving but still lags the other major indexes, weighed down by industrial heavies...

    The Dow is improving but still lags the other major indexes, weighed down by industrial heavies Alcoa (AA -1.7%) and Caterpillar (CAT -0.5%) responding to Japan's unexpectedly weak Q2 growth. Filling a void created by a Japanese spending drop won't be easy, but CAT may have a silver lining: the rapidly rising yen, which could make it more competitive with Japanese giant Komatsu.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan (FCX -2.2%) shares slide after a Deutsche Bank report paints a bleak picture...

    Freeport McMoRan (FCX -2.2%) shares slide after a Deutsche Bank report paints a bleak picture for China copper demand. Inventory pressure will outstrip demand recovery, the report says, and a trend toward restocking may not become evident until Q1 2013: "Without significant restocking activities, any rally in copper prices based on expectations will likely not be sustainable."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 6 Comments
  • KNDI

    Kandi Technologies (KNDI -7.7%) slides after announcing at the China International Green Vehicle...

    Kandi Technologies (KNDI -7.7%) slides after announcing at the China International Green Vehicle Industry Expo that its wholly owned subsidiary, Zhejiang Kandi Vehicles, has signed a Cooperative Framework Agreement for the Promotion of Self-driving Electric Vehicle Rental for Public Transportation in Hangzhou Project with Zhejiang Guoxin Vehicle Leasing Company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • EBAY

    Shares of eBay (EBAY ) jump +3.1% higher after ChannelAdvisor tips off that July same-store...

    Shares of eBay (EBAY ) jump +3.1% higher after ChannelAdvisor tips off that July same-store sales growth came in at 28.2%. The solid gain was led by strong growth in the the company's fixed-price format, while eBay Motors also performed well for the month.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • ALXA

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA +41%) is soaring today on no specific news. One possible lead could...

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA +41%) is soaring today on no specific news. One possible lead could come from the company's earnings call transcript, released late Friday. It provided further color on recent inspections by both the EMA and FDA on its Mountain View facility, and an update on the anticipated approval of its schizophrenia and bipolar disorder drug Adsuasive, which is expected to get clearance in both Europe and the U.S. later this year. (Transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro's (TSO +9.2%) $2.5B purchase of BP's California refinery looks cheap: at ~15% of its...

    Tesoro's (TSO +9.2%) $2.5B purchase of BP's California refinery looks cheap: at ~15% of its replacement value vs. the industry norm of 25%-30% after factoring in plans to sell certain assets in the deal to its MLP (TLLP), a consultant tells Bloomberg. Analysts say refiners like TSO have more upside given the discount available to buyers of U.S. crude, which still trades well below Brent crude.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • SRWRF

    Solar stocks are weak today (TAN -2.8%), possibly due to a guidance cut from SolarWorld...

    Solar stocks are weak today (TAN -2.8%), possibly due to a guidance cut from SolarWorld (OTCPK:SRWRF): the troubled German module vendor, whose shares fell 12.2% in Frankfurt, now expects 1H sales to be down 36% Y/Y. Bucking the trend is Canadian Solar (CSIQ +1.3%), which just received a $94M loan from China Development Bank. That won't do anything to soothe U.S. and E.U. concerns about Chinese government support for local manufacturers.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • VC

    Shares of Visteon (VC +8.8%) pop after word breaks that the company replaced its CEO. The...

    Shares of Visteon (VC +8.8%) pop after word breaks that the company replaced its CEO. The takeaway from the development is that the auto parts supplier could be broken up and sold off in pieces.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASTI

    Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI +18%) soars after announcing a solar-powered charger for Samsung's...

    Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI +18%) soars after announcing a solar-powered charger for Samsung's hot-selling Galaxy S III. The charger, which will be added to Ascent's EnerPlex consumer products line, will be built into a protective case that also features a battery. Ascent already offers an EnerPlex charger/case for the iPhone 4S.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • GOOG

    Also falling (previous) on news of Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) purchase of Frommer's: YELP -6.7%....

    Also falling (previous) on news of Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) purchase of Frommer's: YELP -6.7%. EXPE -1.9%. A Google spokesperson says the company "can’t wait to start working with [Frommer's] on our goal to provide a review for every relevant place in the world."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • CPB

    Campbell Soup (CPB +2.9%) gets a boost on an upgrade from Goldman to a "conviction list" Buy....

    Campbell Soup (CPB +2.9%) gets a boost on an upgrade from Goldman to a "conviction list" Buy. The firm says in a note to clients that management's marketing and innovation strategy has "dramatically changed," and it sees significant improvements in its the way its canned soup is being brought to market.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 4 Comments
  • TRIP

    Tripadvisor (TRIP -6.0%) and Orbitz Worldwide (OWW -4.2%) slump after the WSJ reports Google...

    Tripadvisor (TRIP -6.0%) and Orbitz Worldwide (OWW -4.2%) slump after the WSJ reports Google will buy the Frommer's brand from John Wiley & Sons (JW.A -0.6%) for an undisclosed amount. A combination of Frommer's with previously-purchased Zagat's poses a threat to the online travel sites.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • TOELF

    Top Japanese chip equipment maker Tokyo Electron (OTCPK:TOELF) is buying U.S. peer FSI...

    Top Japanese chip equipment maker Tokyo Electron (OTCPK:TOELF) is buying U.S. peer FSI International (FSII +52.4%) for $6.20/share, or $252.5M, in cash. The price represents a 53% premium to FSI's Friday close. The deal, which will strengthen TEL's wafer surface preparation offerings, could be weighing a little on Lam Research (LRCX -1.4%), which bought Novellus partly for its surface preparation tech. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • NTAP

    Brean Murray joins Cantor in airing cautious comments about NetApp (NTAP -3%) in advance of...

    Brean Murray joins Cantor in airing cautious comments about NetApp (NTAP -3%) in advance of Wednesday's FQ1 report. While believing NetApp is "attractively valued" based on traditional metrics, Brean thinks the company's FQ2 revenue guidance could fall below Street estimates, and also believes gross margin could come under pressure in 2H. UBS is more positive.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • EROC

    Eagle Rock Energy Partners (EROC -3.5%) unveils a public offering of 8M common units...

    Eagle Rock Energy Partners (EROC -3.5%) unveils a public offering of 8M common units representing limited partner interests to help fund the $227M purchase of two processing plants and pipelines in the Texas Panhandle from BP.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • ACER

    Opexa Therapeutics (OPXA -2.9%) trades lower after the company reported a deeper Q2 loss and...

    Opexa Therapeutics (OPXA -2.9%) trades lower after the company reported a deeper Q2 loss and issued an update on its quarterly corporate developments. Losses grew as R&D costs nearly doubled on the company's preparation for Phase II trials of its lead MS drug therapy Tcelna. Additionally, the company says it's closed financing of its $4.1M private offering, and appointed current board member David Jorden as CFO, effective August 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP -4.4%) dives after Deutsche throws cold water on the idea the company will...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP -4.4%) dives after Deutsche throws cold water on the idea the company will be acquired merely for its spectrum and other assets. The firm estimates Leap's assets are worth $4.6B, whereas its debt and obligations total nearly $6.5B. Leap was hammered a weak ago due to a weak earnings report, but subsequently rallied on buyout hopes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC -3.9%) is lower on chatter suggesting waning interest from Royal Dutch Shell...

    InterOil (IOC -3.9%) is lower on chatter suggesting waning interest from Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A, RDS.B) in a potential deal for IOC's Papua New Guinea exploration licenses.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 8 Comments
  • BCOV

    Brightcove (BCOV -3.1%) sells off after B. Riley starts coverage with a Sell and $11 PT. The...

    Brightcove (BCOV -3.1%) sells off after B. Riley starts coverage with a Sell and $11 PT. The online video hosting firm rallied in late July on a strong Q2 report, but has more than given back those gains since. Brightcove's lock-up expiration, which arrives on Thursday, is likely weighing on shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro's (TSO +6%) $2.5B purchase of BP's Carson oil refinery goes against the prevailing wisdom...

    Tesoro's (TSO +6%) $2.5B purchase of BP's Carson oil refinery goes against the prevailing wisdom that says California is a lousy place to be a refiner because of the state’s environmental regulations. The deal brings the number of TSO's California refineries to three and lifts its operations in the state to 60% of its total. TSO says the deal leaves it "well positioned to generate significant operational efficiencies."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 2 Comments
  • VECO

    Veeco (VECO -5.7%) slumps after Deutsche downgrades to Hold and sets a $38 PT. The firm believes...

    Veeco (VECO -5.7%) slumps after Deutsche downgrades to Hold and sets a $38 PT. The firm believes expectations of modest 2013 improvement in MOCVD equipment sales to LED and solar manufacturers are now baked in, and is also worried an expected 2H bookings recovery could get pushed out by a quarter or two. GT Advanced Tech (GTAT -2.6%) could be falling in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • BLRX

    BioLine RX (NASDAQ:BLRX) -7.8% after the biopharmaceutical development company said on Friday...

    BioLine RX (NASDAQ:BLRX) -7.8% after the biopharmaceutical development company said on Friday that it is offering to sell up to $75M of mixed securities. (filing)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • SYY

    Shares of Sysco (SYY +3.3%) open strong after the company beat the estimate of analysts with its...

    Shares of Sysco (SYY +3.3%) open strong after the company beat the estimate of analysts with its FQ4 report. Though food inflation cut into margins, revenue held relatively stable.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • CHOP

    China Gerui Advanced Materials (CHOP -6.1%) lowers its FY2012 guidance, saying the move reflects...

    China Gerui Advanced Materials (CHOP -6.1%) lowers its FY2012 guidance, saying the move reflects the industry-wide reduction in steel prices which has led to a decrease in its average selling price "primarily due to slowing macroeconomic conditions in China.”

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +5.2%) is rallying ahead of this afternoon's Q2 report. With shares down ~30%...

    Groupon (GRPN +5.2%) is rallying ahead of this afternoon's Q2 report. With shares down ~30% since late June, some of the shorts accounting for 26.6% of Groupon's float (as of July 31) are likely taking profits. The company has seen a raft of negative sell-side reports in recent weeks; one of the most recent came from Sterne Agee, which downgraded Groupon last week on concerns about European demand and competition from LivingSocial. Update: The WSJ notes Groupon's salesforce has seen heavy turnover, as workers struggle to keep up with commission goals.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • FMCN

    Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN) chairman/CEO Nanchun Jiang and several investment firms (including...

    Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN) chairman/CEO Nanchun Jiang and several investment firms (including Carlyle) are offering to take the company private for $27/share, a 15% premium to Focus' Friday close. Focus' board has formed a committee to review the offer, which is the latest in a series of "going private" proposals (previous) made for Chinese ADRs suffering from low valuations, thanks partly to accounting concerns. Shares are halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • UAL

    Shares of United Continental (UAL +2.6%) open higher with a round of insider buying helping to...

    Shares of United Continental (UAL +2.6%) open higher with a round of insider buying helping to buoy sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • SIMO

    Silicon Motion (NASDAQ:SIMO) +4.1% after Deutsche starts coverage with a Buy and $24 PT. The...

    Silicon Motion (NASDAQ:SIMO) +4.1% after Deutsche starts coverage with a Buy and $24 PT. The firm expects SIMO to deliver strong growth thanks to growing sales of solid-state drive controller chips, which it considers "increasingly differentiated," and 4G LTE transceiver chips to Samsung. Deutsche sees these trends offsetting weaker 4G sales to other clients in 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • SLS

    Galena Biopharma (GALE) +6% premarket as it receives a patent from Japan for a Composition of...

    Galena Biopharma (GALE) +6% premarket as it receives a patent from Japan for a Composition of Matter and Method of Treatment patent covering Folate Binding Protein peptide variants for use alone or in combination with FBP cancer vaccine E39. The Japanese patent provides exclusivity in the country until 2022, with additional worldwide patent filings pending.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures are flat to lower following the sharp slowdown in...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures are flat to lower following the sharp slowdown in Japan's growth, with the S&P benchmark -0.1%. Oil futures are higher on heightened concerns about Iran, and Brent reached a 3-month high of $114.48 a barrel. Sears surges 7% on plans to spin off its Hometown and Outlet stores.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • FMCN

    Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN) receives a $27-a-share "go private" offer from a consortium led by The...

    Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN) receives a $27-a-share "go private" offer from a consortium led by The Carlyle Group and FountainVest Partners. The group says a newly-created acquisition company would effect the transaction using a combination of debt and equity capital. FMCN +3.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • PVSW

    Premarket gainers: PVSW +26%. OTC:ASTI +15%. SHLD +8%. JDSU +6%. Losers: CHOP -12%. PSTI -7%.

    Premarket gainers: PVSW +26%. OTC:ASTI +15%. SHLD +8%. JDSU +6%.
    Losers: CHOP -12%. PSTI -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • P

    Pandora (NYSE:P) -4.1% after receiving a downgrade to Equal-weight from Morgan Stanley. MS, an...

    Pandora (NYSE:P) -4.1% after receiving a downgrade to Equal-weight from Morgan Stanley. MS, an IPO underwriter, had been bullish on Pandora since launching coverage.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • GMCR

    Longbow Research defends Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) in a note to clients,...

    Longbow Research defends Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) in a note to clients, saying it remains confident the company can grow both its top and bottom lines in the future. Helping the cause will be a strong promotional push by big-name retailers such as Wal-Mart, Target, and Costco to back Keurig. Shares of GMCR +3.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM | 2 Comments
  • VRNT

    Verint (NASDAQ:VRNT) agrees to acquire Comverse Technology (NASDAQ:CMVT) in a stock swap deal...

    Verint (NASDAQ:VRNT) agrees to acquire Comverse Technology (NASDAQ:CMVT) in a stock swap deal following the completion of CMVT's previously announced distribution of its telecom business and other assets. The deal would eliminate CMVT's majority ownership in and control of VRNT. CMVT +5.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • YGE

    Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) +4.9% premarket on news it obtained the first JIS Q8901...

    Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) +4.9% premarket on news it obtained the first JIS Q8901 certification from Japan, specifying national requirements for system reliability concerning design, production and product warranty for photovoltaic modules. YGE says the certification will help it "establish long-term cooperative relations with Japanese consumers."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • PVSW

    Software and service firm Actian offers $8.50 a share for Pervasive Software (NASDAQ:PVSW),...

    Software and service firm Actian offers $8.50 a share for Pervasive Software (NASDAQ:PVSW), marking a 29.8% premium over Friday's closing price. The firm says its open market bid comes after Pervasive's management spurred merger discussions. PVSW +19.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings (SHLD) plans to spin off its Hometown and Outlet stores along with some select...

    Sears Holdings (SHLD) plans to spin off its Hometown and Outlet stores along with some select hardware stores into a new public company. The new entity will trade under the SHOS ticker symbol on the Nasdaq. SHLD +7.5% premarket. (Previous: SHLD could double to $100 on a sum-of-the-parts-valuation)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM | 9 Comments
  • VC

    Visteon (NYSE:VC) says Don Stebbins steps down as chairman, CEO and president of the company,...

    Visteon (NYSE:VC) says Don Stebbins steps down as chairman, CEO and president of the company, and director Timothy Leuliette is named to fill the roles on an interim basis while it searches for a permanent replacement. Visteon, a Ford spinoff, emerged from bankruptcy protection in 2010 under Stebbins. Shares -1.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • SYY

    Sysco (NYSE:SYY): FQ4 EPS of $0.62 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $11B (+5.9% Y/Y). Shares +3.3%...

    Sysco (NYSE:SYY): FQ4 EPS of $0.62 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $11B (+5.9% Y/Y). Shares +3.3% prerket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM
  • BP

    BP's pain is Tesoro's (TSO) gain, the company agreeing to purchase the oil giant's Carson, CA...

    BP's pain is Tesoro's (TSO) gain, the company agreeing to purchase the oil giant's Carson, CA refinery and ARCO retail operation for about $2.5B. Tesoro (+3.2% premarket) expects the acquisition to be accretive to earnings in each of the first two years of operations. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM
  • GOOG

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) is upgraded to overweight at Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS), the note saying the...

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) is upgraded to overweight at Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS), the note saying the stock trades at a 25% discount to the online ad sector. Carl Quintanilla provides a little more color, saying it's the same analyst who cut Facebook numbers ahead of the IPO. Of Google, he says "social competiton is less than feared." Shares +1.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM

  • European shares open mostly flat-to-lower following Japan's poor but-still-better-than-Europe...

    European shares open mostly flat-to-lower following Japan's poor but-still-better-than-Europe GDP data, although losses are being kept in check by hopes of stimulus from China and the U.S. despite skepticism about how much such action would achieve. EU Stoxx 50 -0.3%, London -0.1%, Paris -0.2%, Frankfurt flat, Madrid -0.2%, Milan +0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 AM

  • Asian shares are lower after the unexpectedly sharp slowdown in Japanese GDP adds to the gloom...

    Asian shares are lower after the unexpectedly sharp slowdown in Japanese GDP adds to the gloom emanating from China, although bulls are hanging their hats on a belief that the slowdown in the latter country will bring stimulus "sooner rather than later." Japan -0.1%, Hong Kong -0.4%, China -0.8%, India -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 AM
